com.topcoder.timetracker.common
Class Helper

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.timetracker.common.Helper
public final class Helper
extends java.lang.Object

This helper class contains the methods for this component to check the arguments , get property value from Config Manager component, and create ObjectFactory.

Version:
3.1
Author:
TCSDESIGNER, TCSDEVELOPER

checkStringWithMaxLength

Check whether the given String is not null and not empty(trimmed), and whether the length is not greater than 64.

Parameters:
str - the String to check.
Returns:
false If the given string is null or empty string (trimmed), or with length greater than 64. true otherwise.

Parameters:

usage - The usage of ids array.
Returns:
True if the given ids array is not empty; False otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given ids array is null or contains non-positive values.

getPropertyValue

public static java.lang.String getPropertyValue(java.lang.String namespace,
                                                java.lang.String propertyName)
                                         throws CommonManagerConfigurationException

Returns the value of the property in the given namespace.

If the given property is missing or with an empty(trimmed) value, then it will cause an CommonManagerConfigurationException.

Parameters:
namespace - the namespace to get the property value from.
propertyName - the name of property
Returns:
the value of the property, will never be null or empty(trimmed).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given parameter is null or empty(trimmed).
CommonManagerConfigurationException - if fail to load the config values.

getObjectFactory

public static com.topcoder.util.objectfactory.ObjectFactory getObjectFactory(java.lang.String namespace,
                                                                             java.lang.String objectFactoryNS)
                                                                      throws CommonManagerConfigurationException

Instantiate an ObjectFactory.

Parameters:
namespace - The namespace which contains the objectFactoryNS property.
objectFactoryNS - The name of the property which gives the namespace of ConfigManagerSpecificationFactory.
Returns:
instance of ObjectFactory created.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given parameter is null or empty(trimmed).
CommonManagerConfigurationException - If fail to load the config values or error occurs while creating ObjectFactory.

validatePaymentTerm

public static void validatePaymentTerm(PaymentTerm paymentTerm,
                                       java.lang.String usage,
                                       boolean validateId,
                                       boolean validateModificationUser)

Validate PaymentTerm.

Validation:

  • The given PaymentTerm must be not null;
  • Its term must be positive.
  • Its description must be non-null, non-empty and with length <= 64.
  • Its creation user must be non-null, non-empty and with length <= 64.
  • Its id must be positive if validateId is true; Otherwise its id will not be validated.
  • Its modification user must be non-null, non-empty and with length <= 64 if validateModificationUser is true; Otherwise its modification user will not be validated.

Parameters:
paymentTerm - The PaymentTerm to validate.
usage - The usage of the given PaymentTerm.
validateId - Indicate whether to validate the id of given PaymentTerm.
validateModificationUser - Indicate whether to validate the modification user of given PaymentTerm.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given PaymentTerm is invalid.

validateNotExceed

public static void validateNotExceed(java.util.Date before,
                                     java.util.Date after,
                                     java.lang.Boolean condition,
                                     java.lang.String beforeUsage,
                                     java.lang.String afterUsage)

Validate given before date does not exceed after date.

Validation:

  • If any date is null, IAE is thrown;
  • If before > after, IAE is thrown;
  • If condition is true and before != after, IAE is thrown;
  • If condition is false and before == after, IAE is thrown;

Parameters:
before - The before date to validate.
after - The after date to validate.
condition - Indicate whether before should equal after.
beforeUsage - The usage of the before date.
afterUsage - The usage of the after date.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if validation failed.
